conbody.p: When we first created LearningDITA, we didn't think much about reusing content. It was a shock to learn that we had been advocating reuse, but didn't use it ourselves! However, our first foray into localization showed us how important it was to think about reuse.
At present, we use reuse for:

li.p: The housekeeping topic. Every course begins with information about how to download exercise files and how to work with them. The reusable file for this information is in shared/topics/lc_general_housekeeping.dita.

The first paragraph uses a <xref> element with a keyref to sample_file. This key should be defined in your this_course_keys.ditamap file (see below). This paragraph also uses a key (course_name) to refer to the course name.
Because the content of the exercise files varies from course to course, the second paragraph of this file is a conkeyref:

You define the sample_contents key in your this_course_keys.ditamap file. The ID folder_contents identifies a

element in z_conkeyref_elements.dita in your topics folder.
li.note: We're still working on reuse with this topic. Some of the earlier courses had different content in each housekeeping topic. Making this truly reusable is a work in progress.

li.p: Assessment intro. At the end of every lesson is an assessment that begins with the same text. The topic with this text is in shared/topics/lcc_assessment.dita.

Because this topic is reused across all lessons, we need to avoid naming collisions, which might confuse WordPress, so we use a copy-to attribute in the <topicref> element to give each use a new name. We also use a <navtitle> in the <topicref> to give the topic and appropriate name.

maps/this_course_keys.ditamap. Use this file to define keys used by your course. Use this file to define these keys: course_name - the name of your course sample_file - the href and linktext for the sample file in your LearningDITA WordPress site sample_contents - a

element that describes the content of your sample files
We also strongly recommend using keys to refer to the images used in your

shared/maps/course_keys.ditamap. This file contains keydefs for course links and linktext for their titles. Whenever you refer to another course, create an <xref> element using a keyref from course_keys.ditamap.
